title: Trans-Canada Road Trip
subtitle: Welcome to our Trans-Canadian Story!
blurb_text: After 5 years in Boston, it is time to move on and move North! Follow us on our drive across the American continent! Enjoy!

title: Montreal
subtitle: Visiting Montreal and the McGraths.
blurb_text: Spending the week relaxing and unwinding in the suburbs, with a highlighly regimented lunch and dinner schedule. Also Felix can finally do some gardening.

title: Parc-nature du Bois-de-l'Île-Bizard
subtitle: Bieaver Time!
blurb_text: First day in Canada, and already getting to know the local animals - two beavers!

title: Ottawa
subtitle: Parliament House Tour.
blurb_text: The capital. A lot of old buildings, but the tour of both chambers of pariament was great. Tour guides were as evasive in answering questions as the usual occupants of the buildings - I guess that comes with the job training.

title: Diefenbunker
subtitle: Checking out Canada's Cold War Museum.
blurb_text: Visited the old government bunker in case of a nuclear war. Pretty claustrophobic in it and not sure if you would like to live underground for long. Kathleen was amused by the primitive medical ward of the 60s and 70s. Some old person was still manning the radio station in the facilities - was talking to some amateur radio counterparts in the UK (a bit of a strange hobby).

title: Lake Superior Provintial Park
blurb_text: Driving along the Lake Superior Coastal scenery and checking out the pictograms and nice lakes there.

title: Giant Goose
subtitle: The true rulers of the North!
blurb_text: Even in Boston, the only being car drivers would stop for, were geese. So it is fitting that the true rulers of the northern subcontinent have a shrine dedicated to them, to remind us of their supreme grip of all beings wandering these lands.

title: Voyageurs NP
subtitle: Lakes, lakes and more lakes.
blurb_text: Short dip into the US, with the strangest boarder crossing over an old raildyard bridge. The NP was beautiful and the kayaking between the small islands was great. Just made it out of the water before a storm hit the part (not the last thunderstorm that crossed our path....)

title: Winnipeg
subtitle: Royal Mint and the Winnipeg Police Musem.
blurb_text: We did not expect much from Winnipeg, to be honest. Not an exciting town, but the Royal Mint tour and the Police Museum were great. The retired police officers running the museums were happy to tell and share their stories - must be something Gerald should do when he is retired!  The coffee place in the Forks was the highlight. Barista looked like a real one - schnauzer and tattoos, so that seemd legit.

title: Regina
blurb_text: The only good thing about Regina was that we could bypass it. Not much to report about that city. The Regina-style pizza was ok. Better than Chicago Deep Dish for sure.

title: Moose Jaw
subtitle: The 2025 Tourist Capital of Canada.
blurb_text: Has a giant Moose and jet plane. Also a nice campground. Not much more.

title: Grasslands NP
subtitle: The real Prairies!
blurb_text: Much nicer than its counterpart in the US (Badlands NP). Great camping in the middle of the NP, amazing living skies and sundets. Another sneaky thunderstorm with beautiful lightnings and winds made for rough camping.

title: Welcome to Alberta
blurb_text: 90% of Alberta looks like Saskatchewan, and 10% are the mountains, which are nice!

title: Waterton NP
subtitle: Finally, the moutains!
blurb_text: Clear highlight of the trip. Crypt Lake hike was amazing (no bears - Kathleen was very sad), with stunning views and ice-cold water at the top for a nice cool-down. Felix did not sleep because he was thinking of hearing bears outside the tent, but was just the wind.

title: Osoyoos
subtitle: The surpising stop in the wine-region of BC.
blurb_text: A lot of rain did force us to skip most of the places we wanted to do (but they are only 5h from Vancouver, so will do another time). Stopped for the night in Osoyoos, and was a lucky surprise. Warm, beaches and beautiful scenery. Reminded Felix of southern France with the vineyards and the beautiful sunsets.

title: Vancouver
subtitle: At last, the West Coast
blurb_text: After 13 days of driving and nature, we finally made it to the West Coast! Enjoying the sunshine, the oceanview and beaches of Kitsilano and getting ready for the next adventure.
